channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024010416
item.description:
Report X-2024010416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-23T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A SMALL LEAKING PACKAGE MARKED WITH DIAMOND LABEL- FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 UN1263 PAINT. THE CONTENTS WAS 2- 1 GALLON CONTAINERS OF MOHAWK DURACOAT LACQUER. THE LID WAS OFF THE CANS. BOTH GALLONS WERE ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND PLACED IN GREEN DMP BAG WITH WET CARDBOARD. AWAITING FURTHER INSTUCTIONS FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2024010202
item.description:
Report E-2024010202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: KENTWOOD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 5, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums containing UN1206 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel placed each damaged 55-gallon drum into two (2) 85-gallon salvage drums. R+L terminal personnel had contained the release with granular absorbents, so crews swept them in with hand tools. SET personnel utilized simple green and absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted trailer. All spent absorbents and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024010249
item.description:
Report E-2024010249

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported approximately 1 gallon of resin solution released from one 55-gallon metal drum, the release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal staff were capable of cleaning the release with PPE on-site. (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing product, PPE, and oil dri was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
